question: Question 1-05/20/2024 Which ONE of the following is how delayed neutrons are produced?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1982, Section 3.2
Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1982, Section 3.2
Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1982, Section 3.2
Correct

question: Question 2-05/20/2024 Which ONE of the following describes the term PROMPT DROP?

answers.answer: a. Reactor is subcritical at negative 80-second period
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1982, page 4-21

answers.answer: b. Reactor has attained criticality on prompt neutrons alone
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1982, page 4-21

answers.answer: c. Instantaneous change in power level due to inserting a control rod
answers.feedback: Correct

answers.answer: d. Instantaneous change in power level due to withdrawing a control rod
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1982, page 4-21

question: Question 5-05/20/2024 If reactor period is ________, then reactor power is ________.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-04, page 11
Correct
Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-04, page 11
Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-04, page 11

question: Question 6-05/20/2024 Which ONE of the following describes the relationship between reactivity and criticality?

answers.answer: a. The smaller the absolute value of reactivity in the core, the further the reactor is from criticality.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-03, page 18

answers.answer: b. The larger the absolute value of reactivity in the core, the further the reactor is from criticality.
answers.feedback: Correct

answers.answer: c. Reactivity is zero when the reactor is critical, reactivity is negative when the reactor is supercritical.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-03, page 18

answers.answer: d. Reactivity is zero when the reactor is critical, reactivity is positive when the reactor is subcritical.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-03, page 18

question: Question 7-05/20/2024 Which ONE of the following is the expected stable neutron count rate, given a source strength of 1000 Neutrons/second and a multiplication factor of 0.8?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: CR = S/(1-K) → CR = 1000/(1 - 0.8) = 5000 N/sec
Correct
Incorrect. REF: CR = S/(1-K) → CR = 1000/(1 - 0.8) = 5000 N/sec
Incorrect. REF: CR = S/(1-K) → CR = 1000/(1 - 0.8) = 5000 N/sec

question: Question 8-05/20/2024 Which ONE of the following design characteristics is the reason for the decrease in reactivity following an increase in fuel temperature in a TRIGA reactor?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-03, page 21

answers.answer: b. High fuel element reactivity worth
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-03, page 21
Correct

answers.answer: d. Long delay time for transferring heat to the core cooling water
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-03, page 21

question: Question 9-05/20/2024 Several processes occur that may increase or decrease the available number of neutrons. SELECT ONE of the following, six-factor formula term, that describes an INCREASE in the number of neutrons during the cycle.

answers.feedback: Correct
Incorrect. REF: Burns, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1988, Section 3.3
Incorrect. REF: Burns, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1988, Section 3.3
Incorrect. REF: Burns, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1988, Section 3.3

question: Question 10-05/20/2024 Which ONE of the following describes the difference between prompt and delayed neutrons?

answers.answer: a. Prompt neutrons are produced from spontaneous fission of U-235 in the fuel, and delayed neutrons are the result of fission in U-238.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 1, page 29

answers.answer: b. Prompt neutrons are produced immediately and directly from the fission event and delayed neutrons are produced immediately following the first beta decay of fission fragments.
answers.feedback: Correct

answers.answer: c. Prompt neutrons are responsible for the ability to control the rate at which power can rise in the reactor and delayed neutrons are responsible for the rate at which a reactor can be shut down.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 1, page 29

answers.answer: d. Prompt neutrons ensure there is a sufficient neutron population to overcome the effects of fission product poisoning following a shutdown and delayed neutrons are responsible for lengthening the neutron generation time to ensure the reactor does not go prompt critical.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 1, page 29

question: Question 11-05/20/2024 Which ONE of the following is the definition of ‘Thermal Utilization Factor’?

answers.answer: a. The ratio of the number of fast neutrons absorbed in fuel to the number of fast neutrons absorbed in the reactor material.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-03, page 4

answers.answer: b. The ratio of the number of fast neutrons produced by thermal fission to the number of thermal neutrons absorbed in the fuel.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-03, page 4

answers.answer: c. The ratio of the number of thermal neutrons absorbed in fuel to the number of thermal neutrons absorbed in the reactor material.
answers.feedback: Correct

answers.answer: d. The ratio of the number of fast neutrons produced by thermal fission to the number of thermal neutrons absorbed in the fuel.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-03, page 4

question: Question 12-05/20/2024 The following shows part of a decay chain for the radioactive element Pb-190: _82Pb^190 → _83Bi^190. This decay chain is an example of _______ decay.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Chart of the Nuclides
Correct
Incorrect. REF: Chart of the Nuclides
Incorrect. REF: Chart of the Nuclides

question: Question 13-05/20/2024 During reg rod calibration, doubling time was recorded to be 68 seconds. What was the reactor period?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: T=DT/ln(2) = 68 seconds/0.693 = 98.124 or 98 seconds
Correct
Incorrect. REF: T=DT/ln(2) = 68 seconds/0.693 = 98.124 or 98 seconds
Incorrect. REF: T=DT/ln(2) = 68 seconds/0.693 = 98.124 or 98 seconds

question: Question 14-05/20/2024 Which ONE of the following conditions will DECREASE the core excess reactivity of a reactor?

answers.feedback: Correct

answers.answer: b. Burnout of a burnable poison
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Decreasing the reactivity worth in the core will decrease the core excess

answers.answer: c. Insertion of a positive reactivity worth experiment
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Decreasing the reactivity worth in the core will decrease the core excess

answers.answer: d. Lowering moderator temperature (assume a negative temperature coefficient)
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Decreasing the reactivity worth in the core will decrease the core excess

question: Question 15-05/20/2024 In a subcritical reactor, k_eff is increased from 0.885 to 0.943. Which ONE of the following is the amount of reactivity that was added to the core?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1988, Section 3.3.4
Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1988, Section 3.3.4
Correct
Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1988, Section 3.3.4

question: Question 16-05/20/2024 The count rate for a reactor is 100 cps. An operator inserts an experiment into the core, and the count rate decreases to 55 cps. Given the initial keff of the reactor was 0.95, what is the worth of the experiment?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: CR_1/CR_2 = (1-k_eff2)/(1-k_eff1); Solve for k_eff2, 100/55 = (1- k_eff2) / 1 - 0.95, therefore k_eff2 = 0.91; Δρ = (k_eff2 - k_eff1) / (k_eff2 x k_eff1), (0.91 – 0.95) / (0.91 x 0.95) = - 0.046

Incorrect. REF: CR_1/CR_2 = (1-k_eff2)/(1-k_eff1); Solve for k_eff2, 100/55 = (1- k_eff2) / 1 - 0.95, therefore k_eff2 = 0.91; Δρ = (k_eff2 - k_eff1) / (k_eff2 x k_eff1), (0.91 – 0.95) / (0.91 x 0.95) = - 0.046
Correct

Incorrect. REF: CR_1/CR_2 = (1-k_eff2)/(1-k_eff1); Solve for k_eff2, 100/55 = (1- k_eff2) / 1 - 0.95, therefore k_eff2 = 0.91; Δρ = (k_eff2 - k_eff1) / (k_eff2 x k_eff1), (0.91 – 0.95) / (0.91 x 0.95) = - 0.046

question: Question 17-05/20/2024 Which ONE of the following is defined as the balance between production of neutrons and their absorption in the core for which core leakage can be neglected?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-03, page 2
Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-03, page 2
Correct
Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-03, page 2

question: Question 18-05/20/2024 FAST FISSION FACTOR is defined as a ratio of which ONE of the following?

answers.answer: a. The number of neutrons that reach thermal energy over the number of fast neutrons that start to slow down.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1988, Section 3.3.1, page 3-16

answers.answer: b. The number of fast neutrons produced from fission in a generation over the number of fast neutrons produced from fission in the previous generation.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1988, Section 3.3.1, page 3-16

answers.answer: c. The number of fast neutrons produced from U-238 over the number of thermal neutrons produced from U-235.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, 1988, Section 3.3.1, page 3-16

answers.answer: d. The number of fast neutrons produced from all fission over the number of fast neutrons produced from thermal fission.
answers.feedback: Correct

question: Question 19-05/20/2024 Which ONE of the following parameters is MOST significant in determining the differential rod worth of a control rod?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, Section 7, page 7-4
Correct
Incorrect. REF: Burn, Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, Section 7, page 7-4
Incorrect. REF: Burn, Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, Section 7, page 7-4

question: Question 20-05/20/2024 Which ONE of the following parameter changes will require control rod INSERTION to maintain constant power level following the change?

answers.answer: a. Insertion of a void into the core
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-04, page 30-31

answers.answer: b. Buildup of Samarium in the core
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-04, page 30-31

answers.answer: c. Increase in coolant water temperature (assume a negative temperature coefficient)
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals of Reactor Theory, Volume 2, NP-04, page 30-31

answers.answer: d. Removal of an experiment containing cadmium
answers.feedback: Correct
